snippet: Mr. Baquet, the new executive editor of The New York Times, began reading newspapers when he was a boy so he could keep track of his beloved New Orleans Saints.
abstract: Profile of Dean Baquet, who has replaced The New York Times Executive Editor Jill Abramson; Baquet takes over the paper at a time of upheaval and uncertainty in the news business.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Baquet, the new executive editor of The New York Times, began reading newspapers when he was a boy so he could keep track of his beloved New Orleans Saints.

headline.main: Newspapers Hooked Dean Baquet, New Editor of The Times, at an Early Age
headline.print_headline: A Passion for Saints Football Leads to One for Newspapers, Too
